intro: Ruschia holensis, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, are pollinated by birds and insects. Ruschia holensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
